moves.2. Qf3: So he is looking for the 4 move mate...to defend against this you either advance your pawn to f6 or your knight to f6
moves.2... d6: but not this!. ..Remember, the f7 pawn is the weakest pawn on the board and is often the subject of intense interest by your opponent
moves.3. Bc4: SO here, if you missed it so far, you have three options...p-f6, kn-f6 or bishop -e6
moves.3... Ne7: but not this, not this at all!
moves.4. d3: this was an unnecessary move because the game is over.
moves.4... Nbc6: you are still not defending f6!!
moves.5. Qxf7+: and this is why you need to!
